title: Roof Pitch: Degrees to Rise/Run
summary: Convert pitch angle in degrees into a rise/run ratio.
whenToUse: Use when a pitch angle is given and you need a ratio for set-out.
steps: Confirm the angle is in degrees.
Calculate the tangent of the angle.
Report the ratio as rise per 1 run.
commonMistakes: Forgetting that the ratio is per 1 unit of run.
siteTips: Multiply the ratio by your actual run to get rise.
Keep three decimal places for layout accuracy.
verification: 22.5° should be a little under 0.42 rise per 1 run.
